attributes.action: Allow exception to the hotel quarantine rule in Scotland for EU families
attributes.additional_details:
There are many EU citizens living in Scotland and many Scottish national living in EU. 
When it is proven as emergency, such as a death or illness of loved one or childcare issue, an exception should be made.My husband and myself have no family in this country, in case of emergency nobody could take care of our 1 year old child because our families can't spend the required amount of money to stay in the hotel and even so we would have to wait 10 days to have someone with us.This is very worrying
attributes.background:
Allow members of families to be allowed to enter Scotland directly without quarantine in hotel in case of emergency, providing a negative test result at the airport.
Some families don't have any support network in this country and their only help is situated in EU and viceversa.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee.

If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Allow international travel to visit partners and family: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565102

Do not enforce mandatory hotel quarantines for international arrivals: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571682
